New Records: Corbin Carroll hit a game-winning grand slam, a significant event in the MLB season.
Key Match Events: The New York Mets blew a late lead in the eighth inning, allowing the Arizona Diamondbacks to win the game.
Corbin Carroll hit a game-winning grand slam to seal the win for the Diamondbacks.
Luis Severino was hit by a line drive in the third inning and severely limped around the mound, but stayed in the game.
The Mets' bullpen, short-handed by the unavailability of Dedniel Núñez, pieced together three hitless innings to get the ball to Edwin Díaz.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets were five outs away from taking three of four from the Padres in San Diego and were four outs away from taking the first two of this series against the Diamondbacks on the road.
Brandon Nimmo took a positive approach, saying the Mets were still playing good baseball against good teams.
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets' loss was described as a 'tough loss' and 'a gut punch' by Edwin Díaz and Brandon Nimmo, respectively.
Nimmo said the loss hurts, but the team will move forward.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The math is not kind to the Mets in a National League wild-card race that grows tougher by the day.
The Diamondbacks, Padres, and Braves are all on pace for at least 89 wins, while the Mets are on pace for 84.
Others: Luis Severino will have a painful next three days after being hit by a line drive in the third inning.
Edwin Díaz was wild from the start and hung an 0-1 slider that Corbin Carroll launched into right field for a game-winning grand slam.
